meanings.definition: Of or relating to the study of causes or origins.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted an etiological investigation into the outbreak.
meanings.sent2: The etiological research focused on identifying the root cause of the disease.
meanings.sent3: The etiological analysis of the problem revealed surprising results.
meanings.sent4: Her etiological approach to history uncovered hidden connections.
meanings.sent5: The etiological perspective shed light on the mysterious phenomenon.

meanings.definition: Serving as a cause or origin.
meanings.sent1: The faulty wiring was the etiological factor behind the fire.
meanings.sent2: His careless actions were etiological in the chain of events.
meanings.sent3: The etiological role of the butterfly in the chaos theory amused the students.
meanings.sent4: The etiological link between stress and illness became evident.
meanings.sent5: The etiological influence of culture on behavior was undeniable.

meanings.definition: Explaining the cause or origin of something.
meanings.sent1: The etiological model provided a clear explanation for the phenomenon.
meanings.sent2: Her etiological account of the legend added depth to the story.
meanings.sent3: The etiological tale of the missing sock amused the children.
meanings.sent4: His etiological theory on creativity sparked a lively debate.
meanings.sent5: The etiological narrative painted a vivid picture of the historical event.
